definition: phono-semantic compound character
to appear/to look/form/shape
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Accordingly, some suggestions on pictophonetic characters teaching are made to improve teaching of Chinese as a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 提出了对外汉字教学中有关形声字教学的若干建议。

sentences.english: This article researches the types of error that occur when foreign students process the phonogram characters.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究外国学生在识别形声字时产生的错误。

sentences.english: The significance of Dongba pictophonetic characters and its contribution to the history of written linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 纳西东巴文形声字研究对文字史研究的意义。

sentences.english: Pictophonetic characters are not phonographic, but ideographic in their word forms.
sentences.chinese: 形声字并非表音文字，其字体结构依然遵循表义原则。

sentences.english: Studies on the source-indicating functions of phonetic complements in determinative-phonetic characters are of value to many fields of learning.
sentences.chinese: 研究形声字声符示源功能具有多方面的价值。

sentences.english: The Chinese characters are all most the Picto-phonetic characters in the latest ancient.
sentences.chinese: 中国文字在近古期以后，几乎完全是形声字。

sentences.english: Fifthly, the meaning of pictophonetic character and that of phonetic sign have no relation.
sentences.chinese: 第五种，形声字与声符在意义上没有关系。

definition: combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
phonetic component of Chinese character
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
phonetic component of a Chinese character
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
phonetic/phonological/transliteration
radical of a Chinese character
variant Chinese character
a Chinese character formed by combining existing elements - i.e. a combined ideogram 會意|会意 or radical plus phonetic 形聲|形声
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
character with two or more readings
single-component character
